intro: Argyrolobium flaccidum, commonly known as the flaccid silverlobium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its typical pod-shaped fruits. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Argyrolobium flaccidum is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
